title: Purple Hands 2014 Latchkey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Forward and open, this has chocolaty, brambly raspberry fruit, along with pleasant hints of tobacco, vanilla and caramel. It glides through the palate smoothly, finishing with an elegant touch of stem, from 15% whole cluster fermentation.

title: Quinta da Soalheiro 2014 Terramatter Alvarinho (Minho)
description: This is a ripe, tropical take on Alvarinho. The effects of partial malolactic fermentation in wood are there in the round, creamy character of the wine and the lights touch of oak. It is all ready to drink although it will be even better from late 2016.

title: Piattelli 2011 Grand Reserve Trinità Red (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Warm, loamy, oaky aromas of pastry and blackberry set up a tannic, jammy, cheek-pounding mouthfeel. This is 75% Malbec and the rest Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's dark and chocolaty, with blackberry, prune and coffee flavors. A heaping of chocolate and fig makes the finish quite friendly; drink through 2019.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This is a seriously impressive, ripe and powerful wine. Boasting rich fruits, black plum and berry flavors and concentrated acidity, it also has a dark, solid structure. Still young, this shows boisterous acidity and needs to soften and fill out further. Drink this fine wine from 2018.

title: Wrath 2013 San Saba Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Aromas of cream, baked croissant, lemon custard and dried apricot characterize the nose of this offering from the winery's estate vineyard just below the Santa Lucia Highlands. The palate packs lemon-buttered toast, roasted almonds, seared green apples and a cement element into a strong bottling.

title: Abacela 2013 Barrel Select Malbec (Umpqua Valley)
description: This outstanding Malbec dazzles with scents of tobacco and chocolate, flavors of sour cherry and plum, and impressive concentration and persistence. The flavors gather strength and focus, adding details of lavender and lemon curd, as they roll into a lingering finish.

title: Arbor Brook 2013 Origin 1866 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Tart blackberry and black-cherry fruit is the focus of this medium-density wine with excellent aging potential. The tannins are dusty with black-tea flavors. Put this away for a bit, and drink 2018–2026.

title: Armida 2013 Italo's Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: A burly, robust wine from a 1930s planting containing 5% Petite Sirah, this offers lots of classic character. The mix of leather, herb, blackberry and blackberry gives a sense of completeness. Full bodied, it'll stand up well to further aging. Drink now through 2023.

title: Château Peyrabon 2015 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Dark tannins and layers of black-plum flavors give this wine weight and richness. The structure is there, showing a dry edge alongside spice and a juicy aftertaste.

title: Château Pibran 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is spicy, packed with tannins that are well integrated with the black fruits. It is rich, it is round and it will develop quickly.

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2013 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Lifted, fresh notes of peach on nose and palate somehow manage to pull off a wine of utter freshness that is soft, mellow and rounded at the same time. The peachy fruit pervades the entire palate which has just a smidgeon of residual sweetness and a helpful, balancing edge of pleasant bitterness.

title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is ripe, with rich orange-marmalade flavors that are happily cut by bright acidity. It is a beautifully generous wine, with a sharp squirt of lemon at the end.

title: Château Cantin 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. Ripe and juicy, this is a well-balanced wine. Tannins and fine acidity are filled out by the berry fruits and perfumes from Cabernet Franc in the blend. The wine will develop relatively quickly and be ready to drink in early 2020s.

title: Château Fourcas-Borie 2015 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This is a structured wine, showing its dense and dusty tannins. The ripe blackberry fruit shines through strongly with hints of freshness, and more richness. This is concentrated and serious, ready for aging.

title: Château Haut-Beauséjour 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 90–92. Barrel Sample. This wine is spicy, ripe and gently textured. With hints of stalkiness, the black currant fruits are light and crisp with a squeeze of blackberry juice coming through. It is more about fruit than structure.

title: Brick House 2014 Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Brick House was one of the first to plant Gamay Noir in the Willamette Valley, and may well be the state's leading producer in terms of quantity. This is loaded with chunky cherry fruit, a penetrating style that simply brings a grin with every sip. Aromatics of root beer, sassafras and hard cherry candy add to the complexity.

title: Bruliam 2013 Rocky Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This is a high-acid, minerality-driven wine from the wilds of Rockpile. Soft and integrated in terms of oak and tannin, it also possesses a savage touch of grip, a nod to its mountainous heritage and the perils and pleasures of a warm year. Black cherry and a vibrant squeeze of citrus stand out on the palate, providing juiciness and balance.

title: Byington 2013 Block 4 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Lush and buttery smells of cherry pie, caramel, lilacs and blackberry muffins are quite inviting on this block-designated estate wine. Strawberry and ripe raspberry play with croissant flavors on the palate, which is excellent though not quite as decadent as the nose.

title: Carmel 2010 Kayoumi Single Vineyard Shiraz (Galilee)
description: A bouquet of black cherry, toffee and violet sets the stage for flavors of black cherry, coffee, caramel and soft notes of mint. Acidity and tannins are well balanced, and the appealing finish features bright notes of lightly caramelized fruit and soft touches of mint.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Opaco Red (Lisboa)
description: The wine is produced from old Alicante Bouschet and Sousão vines both of which contribute to the dark, almost black color. It is concentrated while with considerable acidity, tannins and a mouth- tingling juicy black currant character. The wood-aged, spicy wine needs to age much longer to even begin the round out, so don't drink before 2018.

title: Spice Route 2012 Chakalaka Red (Swartland)
description: Chakalaka is always a bold and powerful selection, and the 2012 follows suit, with dense notes of black berry, plum and cherry that are framed by hints of lavender, licorice, laurel and celery seed. The medium-bodied palate offers spicy notes of pepper and bittersweet cocoa, with a lingering espresso tinge on the finish. A blend of 29% Syrah, 29% Mourvèdre, 13% Grenache, 13% Carignan, 8% Tannat and 8% Petite Sirah.

title: Russiz Superiore 2011 Riserva Sauvignon (Collio)
description: This elegantly structured white opens with scents of citrus, yellow stone fruit, chopped herb and a light whiff of oak. The polished palate offers yellow peach, apricot, tangerine zest and mineral alongside fresh acidity. A hint of vanilla closes the finish.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Quinta da Viçosa Single Vineyard Red (Alentejano)
description: From a single vineyard, this unusual blend of Aragonez and Petit Verdot is a serious, solid and intensely dense wine. It may be three-years-old, but it is still so young. The dark texture and firm tannins are dominant with flavors of dark chocolate and concentrated black plum skins along with acidity. This is a serious wine that will age for several years. Drink from 2019.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2014 Wineck-Schlossberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
description: Subtle, friendly notes of lemon peel and flesh perfume the nose and continue in their light, sunny vein on the palate. There is a riper aspect as well that references yellow pear and ripe, juicy apples. The purity shines and the acidity is so fresh it is almost textural. A bright, joyous wine.

title: Kaleidos 2012 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Dark and viscous in the glass, this wine shows chipped asphalt, concentrated blueberries, uncracked peppercorns, budding violet, chocolate cake and earthy, black loam on the packed-with-potential nose. The soft and plush palate carries that loamy flavor forward, with dried black-cherry fruit and a menthol-like sensation leading into the finish. Drink 2018–2022.

title: Liberalia 2007 Cabeza de Cuba Crianza  (Toro)
description: Earthy, mature aromas of mushroom, leather and foresty berry fruits are oaky but nice. Bullish, scratchy tannins make for a rough mouthfeel, while flavors of roasted black fruits come with bold meaty notes. A solid, salty tasting finish is tannic, but overall this is ready to drink now through 2021.

title: Martin Schaetzel 2013 Kaefferkopf Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: For an aromatic variety the nose is rather subdued—pleasantly so—but hints at ample ripe peachiness. The palate brings this to the fore in an off-dry but balanced manner: silky and glistening with the ripeness of plump, sun-ripened peach. The finish is warm and soft, with wonderful understatement.

title: Glunz 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aged in 100% new American oak for 14 months, this big wine shows tobacco, roasted beef and campfire aromas cut by fresh boysenberry fruit and pencil lead. The medium-bodied palate is packed with flavors, ranging from tart elderberry, smoked meats and graphite to oregano, oak and thyme.

title: Gradis'ciutta 2013 Bratinis White (Collio)
description: Aromas of fragrant white flower, peach, chopped herb and exotic fruit lead reveal themselves on this radiant blend of Chardonnay, Ribolla Gialla and Sauvignon. The structured, focused palate offers Golden Delicious apple, nectarine zest and mineral while crisp acidity provides the elegant framework.

title: Grizzly Peak 2012 Syrah (Rogue Valley)
description: This satiny wine opens with fairly typical Syrah flavors of ripe cherry, kahlua liqueur and dark chocolate. It expands deliciously in the glass, showing ripeness, balance and silky smooth-tannins.
